Entries.default:
"We gather in the sight of Woedica and Wael to thresh truth from falsehood and see justice upheld."

The voice seems to echo from nowhere in particular, though the figures before you present the tableau of a trial in progress.
You hold the court's attention. Masked inquisitors look upon you, stiff-backed and confident in their authority. Hooded figures line the pit, attentive to the proceedings.
[Use the broken dagger relic to take on the role of the accused.]
[Use the relic to take on the role of the inquisitor.]
Before you, the elf you saw chained above stands bloodied and shackled, her gaze lowered to the stones.
"How do you answer these charges?"
"I deny them. I serve the gods with every fiber of my being."
"I accept them. I have wronged the gods, and I pray forgiveness."
"You mean apostates weaken the apparent authority of your 'infallible truth.'"
"You are accused of abandoning the faith. How do you answer these charges?"
"Free the prisoner. She has committed no crime."
"I don't know what to say. I didn't actually think that would work."
"Many have made similar claims within these walls. If only words bore the weight of actions."
"Your contrition credits you."
The court's many figures erupt in hissing whispers.
"Does this not gnaw at you? Did you not join the clergy to help kith?"
"Like you, I spread the will of the gods."
"If I don't serve the gods, I wish you'd tell them. Maybe then they'd stop visiting me."
"I reject your authority! This court is a sham set to fulfill the will of Thaos!"
"I apologize. Both for my comment, and for my sins."
"I bear no guilt."
The court's many figures erupt in hissing whispers.

"What?"

The chained elf's brown eyes widen.
The accused cringes at the sound of your voice as the other inquisitors exchange expressions of concern.
"The gods were forged by Engwith of its own people's souls in order to control you!"
"The gods want us to lead by example, not force conversion at the point of a blade."
"Is this true? Are you an apostate?"
"What evidence do the witnesses present?"
"I'm convinced. Let's punish her."
"So, uh, you did a pasta thing, eh?"
A moment of silence passes in the chamber as the inquisitor peers down on you.
The inquisitor shakes her head sadly.
"This tribunal derives its authority from the divine and concerns itself not with your acceptance of it."

"Then die you shall." 

She raises her hand, the robe slipping to reveal a dark, bony arm, and weapons appear among the gathered Engwithans.

"The matter before this tribunal tonight - apostasy."

The dagger again warms, oozing its thick ichor.
"This certainly feels familiar!"
[Attack the gathered court.]
Your words die on the air, as if spoken into a blanket. None of the gathered apparitions respond to them in any way.
"Well I thought it was funny."
None of the gathered figures respond.
"If you want to give folks a chuckle, it's all in the delivery and timing. Work on it, you'll get there."
She gently shakes her head, lids drooping over her golden eyes.
"Not sure this, eh, be the time, cap." He winces, rubbing the back of his head with a furry paw.
Ydwin pinches the bridge of her nose, slowly shakes her head, and sighs.
"Is, is he always this way?" The godlike coughs into a closed hand.
Entries.female: "Is, is she always this way?" The godlike coughs into a closed hand.

Entries.default: "The heretic may transgress out of ignorance or misunderstanding. Far fouler the apostate, who, knowing full well the truth, elects to abandon it."
"Each heretic, being a potential convert, presents an opportunity for an improved Eora. The apostate, however, blights the world around him, for from him does corruption stem."
"In abandoning the true faith, you corrupt not only yourself, but all with whom you share contact."
"How exactly do I abandon something I never was a part of?"
"You mask yourself - are you ashamed of your actions here?"
"Whether or not you ever truly devoted yourself to the gods, there is no question you once served them."
"You abstract your choices in phrases such as 'this body' and 'the tribunal.' You preemptively refuse responsibility for your actions."
"There is no shame to be found in the service of the gods. The masks we wear reflect our roles as mere instruments of a divine will."
[Attack] "Enough of this."
"Not all who wear masks do so out of shame."
"You're proud then, of that visage?"
"I'm certainly not ashamed. I didn't run off to the Vailian Republics."
"Silence!"
"Only to the Deadfire. And the Beyond."
"If you choose to squander this opportunity with further heresy, we can return you to your confinement."
"Screw the gods! Was that better?"
"You do not take rejection well, do you?"
"In fairness to the farmer, cap, you ain't one to suffer it lightly neither."
"Your refusal to recant dismays this tribunal. You require further illustration of the harmfulness of your irreverence."
"For your soul's sake, I pray your repentance genuine."
"Kith have devised no punishment too harsh for the apostate. That all should know the wages of perfidy, your sentence shall be carried out in Sun in Shadow."
"This tribunal shall reconvene in three nights' time. Until then, you shall mount the bladed horse."
"You shall be denied all food and drink, that your spirit is not unduly weighted by your body."
"You may at any time recant your apostasy and offer contrition in the names of your confederates in atheism."
"Sounds fun. Bring me to that mount thing."
"Are you kidding?"
"This hardly seems fair."
[Attack] "If I'm to die, it'll be here on my feet!"
"The sentence has been pronounced, and so shall it be carried out. All praise be to the gods."
"As unfair as the scorn you heap upon those who gave you this world? This life?"
"We are not. Nor do we appreciate your tone."
"Your genitals shall be burned away with heated iron, that your corrupt seed poses no danger of spreading."
"No food shall be spared you save your own leavings, no drink save your own water, that you leech no more from the divinities you spurn, but subsist on the same filth you would feed others."
[Remain silent.]
"Ew."
"You shall be refused the Wheel's mercy. When the Beast of Winter claims the festering remnants of your corpus, your spirit shall be collected and consigned to the eternal pillars of Breith Eaman."
"Desgant! Di verus, this is even worse than I would have expected from the Engwithans."
"I accept this penance."
"The sentence has been pronounced, and so shall it be carried out. All praise be to the gods."

"You would bring words of heresy into this hallowed hall?"

She looks to the gathered witnesses.

"Still you lie."

Her hooded head swishes quietly as she shakes it.
"I am the Herald of Berath. I bear her mark."
"I serve Eothas. I am the light in the darkness."
"I serve the Skaen, and I will remember this wrong."
"Magran is my mistress, and I shall purify this place in her flames!"
"One of you is dead, you know? The rest of you are but echoes of her madness."
"You did, once. Making your current perfidy all the more dispiriting."
"I too, strive to help others. Not through torture, though. Not through fear."
"I too, strive to help others. Not through torture, though. Not through fear."
"Or was it always the self-righteous cruelty that appealed to you?"
"I pray that you truly believe that, and thus understand the necessity of this sentence."
[Say nothing.]
"Watch and learn, Aloth."
"Yes, Watcher, do show me how it's done."
"'Apostasy.' It means abandoning the faith."
"Getting better. Just try and make it sound like you're not trying."
"I bear guilt for many things, but in my service to the divine I have never wavered. Never once."
Pinching the bridge of her nose, Ydwin sighs.
"Listen, all of you! Your faith is false!"
"What are you saying?" The chained elf blinks up at you in confusion.
"No crime? Her perfidy is legendary!"
"I'm open to suggestions."
"It seems we are meant to charge the accused with a crime."
"Try and call for a vote of no confidence. I don't know what'll happen, but at least it'll sound good."
"Try and fit in, maybe? I don't want to know what happens when these spirits get rattled from their illusion."
"See if you can set this soul free. If you have the power to interfere, perhaps you can help them."
"Usually this sort of thing ends in someone walking the plank, aye? Mayhaps that be what this hole is for."
"Your guess is as good as mine. My lantern don't seem to do a thing here."
"This is a mummer's farce. Play your part or do not. But do something."
"You've got their attention. People tend to trust the person in the middle. Use that."
"Ask her how she answers her crime!" one of the witnesses cries.
[Attack] "I said let her go!"
Weapons appear among the spirits as you turn against them.
[Attack] "Enough of this sham!"
Weapons appear among the spirits as you turn against them.
"What say the witnesses?"
"I've only ever served the gods. What I've done for them... The sacrifices I've made..."
"Liar!"
"Monster!"
"Heresy!"
Discontented growls spread among the gathered spirits. Tears, however, line the accused elf's cheeks.
"The inquisitor has been turned!"
"Capture her! She shall pay for her sins!"
The scene shimmers and breaks apart around you, leaving behind a pulsing fragment of essence.
"The inquisitor has been turned!"
"Capture her! She shall pay for her sins!"
The scene shimmers and breaks apart around you, leaving behind a pulsing fragment of essence.
"Her many sins are a matter of record! That she denies them compounds her guilt!"
"It seems my guilt a foregone conclusion. Why then bother with this farce?"
[Attack] "Enough of this sham!"
"The witnesses provide no evidence of consequence."
"I'm unconvinced. She is to be released!"
"Then declare your sentence. What example will be made of me?"
"A quick death."
"Cut off her ears and flay her skin from her back."
"That was obviously a joke. We're releasing her."
The accused's head falls as the other gathered figures pray their thanks to Woedica.
